title: Hollywood font (1960) - digital alternative
content:
Hi!   
   
Can anyone recommend a font which is a close match of this sixties sign?   
   
 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20050515203734im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/70600.gif)   
   
Thanks for your help,   
Seb
author: allaboutseb

comments.content: It looks like it's based on the italic of [ITC Bookman](http://web.archive.org/web/20050515203734/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/itc-bookman/medium-italic/testdrive.html?s=Hollywood&p=48), or Bookman Old Style. The serifs have been flattened, but the basic letterforms, especially of the y and w are from the italic typeface.

Thanks Mike. I checked out Bookman and it s a pretty close match. Funny enough that you point out the y and w - there are the letter shapes i fell in love with ![:-)](http://web.archive.org/web/20050515203734im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/happy.gif)

[Century Bold Italic](http://web.archive.org/web/20050515203734/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/efscangraphic/century-no1-sb/bold-ita/testdrive.html?s=Hollywood&p=48) would be closer in my opinion. Even better would be Century Bold Italic Condensed, but I can't seem to find it. The biggest difference is that the l's and d have non-cursive forms and the H is missing the inside serifs.

Looks like a mix of (slanted) ITC Century Bold Condensed and ITC Century Bold Condensed Italic.   
Eg the serifs of the roman and the y and w of the italic.
